### Welcome

I teach courses on biostatistics and data science [at
UBC](https://www.zoology.ubc.ca/person/vikram-baliga). I regularly instruct or
coordinate [BIOL 300](files/Syllabus_BIOL300_2025.pdf): Fundamentals of
Biostatistics. Future efforts may relate to [DSCI
100](https://ubc-dsci.github.io/dsci-100-student/) or courses that blend
biology, statistics, and data science.

Previously, I was a scientist (also at UBC) who used motion capture and virtual
reality to investigate flight control in birds. Data from studies of behavior
and neuroscience often require semantic validation and dealing with noise.
Making sense of information in these contexts made me appreciate the importance
of statistical thinking, sanity checks, and effective visualizations.
